oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Double barrel shotgun with ruptured barrel
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Tom Forkner guardian of John Forkner ran a store in Forked Creek, Monroe County, Tennessee and made plug tobacco. Two teenaged boys who worked for him got into a fight and one of them overloaded the shotgun. Tom Forkner seized the gun and placed it in the fork of a tree and pulled a string to fire it and thus exploded the barrel. Tom Forkner's actions probably saved the boy's life. All of this ocurred sometime before 1875.
